title: Scott Boras says he, Alex Bregman are ‘waiting until the offseason’ before making opt-out decision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman will decide on his contract opt-out with the Red Sox after the 2025 season, his agent confirmed.
Bregman, 31, signed a three-year, $120 million contract, with opt-outs after the 2025 and 2026 seasons.
Bregman has been influential in mentoring Boston's young players despite his potential departure, per reports.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Misery' (1990), a Rob Reiner-directed horror-thriller, is streaming on HBO Max.
'Warfare' (2025), a film co-directed by Ray Mendoza, is available on HBO Max.
'Only Murders in the Building' Season 5 is now streaming on Hulu.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez, Keion White ruled out vs. Dolphins
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots cornerback Christian Gonzalez (hamstring) and defensive end Keion White (illness) are ruled out for Sunday's game against the Dolphins.
Gonzalez hasn't practiced since July 28 and missed the Week 1 game against the Raiders, which New England lost 20-13.
Linebacker Marte Mapu (neck) and offensive tackle Morgan Moses (foot) are listed as questionable for Sunday's matchup in Miami.

title: With DC Terrell Williams out, who will be calling defensive plays for Patriots vs. Dolphins?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots inside linebackers coach Zak Kuhr will call defensive plays against the Dolphins with DC Terrell Williams absent.
Kuhr previously called plays during practices and is in his first season coaching inside linebackers for the Patriots.
Mike Vrabel has confidence in Kuhr's readiness, citing his experience from Ohio State to the Tennessee Titans.

title: Boston activist Monica Cannon-Grant to plead guilty in federal fraud case
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Monica Cannon-Grant plans to plead guilty in her upcoming federal fraud case, postponing her trial scheduled for October 14.
The activist and her late husband allegedly defrauded donors, misused nonprofit funds, and lied on mortgage applications.
Cannon-Grant faces charges including wire fraud and conspiracy, risking decades in prison and significant financial penalties.

title: Here’s what we know about Tyler Robinson, Charlie Kirk’s alleged assassin
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Tyler Robinson, 22, from Washington, Utah, was arrested for the alleged murder of Charlie Kirk in Utah.
Robinson is a third-year student at Dixie Technical College and has no prior criminal cases according to records.
Family said Robinson recently became more political and viewed Kirk, an ally of Trump, as spreading hate.

title: 7 things to know about a pivotal Red Sox-Yankees series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Red Sox host the Yankees for a pivotal series at Fenway Park, crucial for the American League wild card race.
Boston leads the season series against New York 8-2 and will start pitchers Giolito, Bello, and Crochet this weekend.
Yankees have hit 249 home runs this season, needing power for success, while Red Sox face lineup struggles post-injury.

title: Winthrop loses $1.2M in climate grants over MBTA Communities Act noncompliance
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Winthrop lost $1.2 million in climate grants due to noncompliance with the MBTA Communities Act.
The funds were intended for flood mitigation in Morton and Fisherman's Bend neighborhoods, critical areas affected by flooding.
Town Council rejected a zoning proposal to comply with the MBTA law, affecting future state funding opportunities.

title: Healey orders flags at state buildings flown at half-staff to honor Charlie Kirk
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Gov. Maura Healey ordered Massachusetts flags at half-staff to honor Charlie Kirk until sunset on Sept. 14.
Charlie Kirk was fatally shot at Utah Valley University; Tyler Robinson arrested, motive unclear.
President Trump called for nationwide mourning, praising Kirk and condemning political violence.

title: A family-friendly guide to apple picking in New England
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Honey Pot Hill Orchards in Stow, MA offers over 30 apple varieties, three mazes, and a petting zoo for kids.
Cider Hill Farm in Amesbury, MA features more than 60 apple varieties, a sandbox, trike yard, and a hard cider bar.
New Hampshire's Applecrest Farm Orchards hosts Harvest Festivals with horse-drawn hayrides, a petting zoo, and themed weekends.
